column1: fuller outside off, goes for the drive but fails to middle, the ball rolls towards third man
fuller again, just outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers
gets off the mark with a boundary, not very convincingly though. Fuller again, just outside off, McCollum goes for the drive but gets a thick outside edge past first slip
length ball around off, taps it towards covers from the crease
goes for the yorker, swinging in to the batsman who does well to get his bat down in time
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover
length around off, coming in with the angle, Stirling defends it from the front foot
once again a length ball around off, defended from the front foot
length again, around middle and leg this time, Stirling gets behind the line of this and blocks again
length ball around off, defended again
a touch fuller around off this time, Stirling takes half a step forward and blocks again
length ball around off, defended from the front foot once again
fuller and angling across, opens the face of the bat to guide it towards third man
short and some room outside off this time, Stirling gets on top of the bounce and cuts it hard and away towards deep point
length around off, comes forward and pushes it past the cover fielder for a couple
length around off, comes forward and just presents the full face of the bat to run it past extra cover, gets another brace
straying on the pads this time and tucked away towards midwicket for a single
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and digs it out towards extra cover
length around off, comes forward and blocks again
dropped by Fabian Allen at square leg. Length ball on the pads and flicked in the air, straight to the fielder, in and out
length around off, comes forward and blocks
short of length around off, stays in his crease, rises on the toes and defends
short of length but straying down the leg side this time, Stirling helps it on its way to the fine-leg boundary
fuller around off and leaving the batsman who comes forward and looks to defend, gets beaten
caught behind! Cottrell brings out the salute celebration. Length ball in the corridor, McCollum chases it and gets a healthy edge. A regulation catch for Shai Hope behind the stumps
short of length outside off and punched off the back foot but straight to the cover fielder
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover, straight to the fielder
short of length around middle and leg, looks to flick it down the leg side, misses and is rapped on the pads
length ball outside off, drives on the up but straight to cover
Back of a length and angling in again, he punches from the crease
sticking to the back of length line coming into him from wide of the crease, gets this to bounce a tad higher and Stirling pats it down from above his waist
he's keeping the batsman guessing, this one was a lot fuller and straighter, played back to the bowler with a straight bat
fuller, on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
strays on the pads a little and is clipped, but straight to square leg, so still no run
keeps it straighter but not on a drivable length, tight bowling and it's a maiden over. Fullish on middle, defended back
steered to third man
good length on the stumps, bunted back to the bowler
ooh painful blow slightly back of a length but very straight, and he wanted to pull it, but doesn't connect. The ball hits him in the midriff
length ball on the pads, tucked to deep square to break a sequence of eight dot balls for Stirling
good length, keeping it stump to stump, he stays in his crease and punches to cover with minimal foot movement
a little fuller and driven back to the bowler's right, but Cottrell does well to stop it on his follow through
good length, on around the fifth stump and nipping in a touch, defended back to the bowler's right
good length outside off again, pushed to cover
lovely shot and what a fine way to break a sequence of eight dot balls for Stirling against Roach. Too full and he shows the full face of the bat to drive it straight back down the ground
goes back to his familiar back of length angling in delivery and Stirling defends it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, coming in and defended from the crease
sticks to his back of length delivery coming in, gets it to bounce a fair bit, but Stirling keeps it down from between waist and chest

good shot but the outfield seems very slow. Angling a little across and very full outside off, Balbirnie comes on the front foot to execute a good looking off-drive but the mid-off is able to run back and pull it in before the fence
back of a length outside off, punched confidently to point
too short on leg stump and he gets inside the line to pull it over short fine leg for a boundary. Good placement, he was aware the fielder was inside and the length allowed him to go over
punched to cover
very full again, and driven, but can't beat mid-on. Didn't time that perfectly

length ball on leg stump and that is flicked away effortlessly by Balbirnie. Just stayed in his crease and used his wrists to whip it to deep midwicket, where the man from deep square runs to his left to field

wasn't in control of that but it goes on the bounce to fine leg. A little short and he wanted to pull it away, but didn't get it off the middle. A top edge, but not connected well enough to carry all the way
good length, nipping in from off, punched to mid-on
good length, punched to cover
short ball outside off, dug it in  but it sails harmlessly past off stump, with Balbirnie keeping eyes on the ball and swaying out of the way
nicely tucked off his pads
a dipping full toss on the stumps, driven back towards the bowler
almost an action replay of the first ball, Stirling pushes the low full toss gently towards the bowler
fuller, angling in towards the leg stump, driven inside out towards deep extra cover
fuller around middle and leg, pushed towards the non-striker, Allen dives across to prevent the single
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on for one
a high full toss one the stumps, Stirling comes forward and drives it towards long-off
short of length outside off, cuts it towards backward point
back of length outside off, some extra bounce as well, Stirling steers it towards third man
short of length outside off, Balbirnie pulls it away, in front of the square, the fielder at deep square leg had no chance as it bounces towards the midwicket boundary
another short one, Balbirnie swivels across this time and pulls it behind square for four more
length ball but angling on the pads, tucked away towards the left of the keeper for one
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards midwicket, the fielder is at the boundary and that allows the batsmen to come back for the second
fuller down the leg side, Balbirnie goes for the sweep but Gabriel makes a diving stop to his left at short fine leg
change of pace this time, length around off, pushed towards sweeper cover
fuller outside off, drives it on the front foot towards sweeper cover
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it back
length around off, punches it towards extra cover from the crease
short of length outside off and coming in with the angle, cuts the batsman in half as Balbirnie looks to punch it on the off side, kept a touch low as well
short of length in the corridor this time, left alone by the batsman
short of length around off, Balbirnie gets on the top of the bounce and punches it towards covers
length outside off, sixth stump line, left alone
fuller and wider outside off, left alone
back of length outside off, punches it towards point
fuller on off, worked away with his wrists to long on
flatter, pushed to point
room outside off and he executes the glide perfectly, opening the face of the bat to run it past short third man
tossed up, but drifts on the pads and that is a superbly executed sweep shot. Goes down on his knee and gets a meaty part of the bat on it to send it to the square leg boundary
fuller, driven back to the bowler

swept fine again, and with the same result. He's picking the right ones to sweep, this was also in the slot and on leg stump - a low full toss in fact. He moved inside the line and this time, concentrated more on placement than power - got the same result.
back of a length outside off, cuts it to point
too full outside off, and room to drive. There is protection at sweeper cover though, so only a single
through him. Back of a length but keeps a bit low while coming in. He hangs his bat out to push, it sneaks just past the inside edge, but not cutting in enough to take out off stump
flowing drive with a bat flourish to this full one outside off, but deep cover cleans up
good length outside off, punched to extra cover
pulled in front of square. Authoritative shot, to a short ball dug in outside off, and he gets into position nicely to smack that to the boundary
Good length outside off, he stays in his crease and defends
almost yorker length on the stumps but not quite, allowing him to go back a little and drive it past the bowler. No timing on that, so mid-on can run around and field it
fullish, angling into off, defended
pleasing cover drive, down on one knee to a full one outside off, but he can't beat extra cover
good length outside off, waits for it and opens the face of the bat to guide it to point's left and they take a single
fuller on off, driven but not timed too well, and straight to mid-on
good length, angling into the middle stump, he comes forward and plays it down to mid-on
back of a length on off, steered to point
nice line, in the corridor outside off and on a hard length. Stirling shoulders arms, judging correctly that his off stump would be safe.
dismissed. Dug this in short and Stirling has been punishing those, gets on the front foot and pulls it in front of square for a crashing boundary
better length, and nipping in, he's caught on the crease and the ball takes an inside edge onto pad off his forward prod
good length on off, kept a bit low, he gets behind it and defends
back of a length, coming into off, patted down towards short leg and they take a quick single
fuller, angling into him, tried to turn it away but gets it off the pad towards short midwicket
good length on the stumps, pushed into the legside, short midwicket fields
very full, goes to drive, it rolls to square leg off a thick inside edge
gets hold of this on-drive better, but it's straight to mid-on

pulled for four. Not the best choice of ball to bowl with no fine leg, short and on leg stump, and Balbirnie's been hitting them well. He moves inside the line and pulls it fine. Gets only a glove, but that's the only thing needed to send it to the fence
good length, angling into his pads again, tries to work it away but no timing at all on that and it just stops off the bat and rolls into the leg side
good length, on the stumps, gets behind it and punches past the bowler
good length on the fourth stump, he stays in his crease and gets behind it, pushes to cover
angling into him again and straightens a touch, Stirling was moving across a touch, manages to jab it towards mid-on
fuller outside off, given room and he eases into the drive to deep cover
length ball, coming into him and he pushes at it, gets an inside edge that rolls to short fine leg
full on the stumps, driven to mid-on
nicely cut away past backward point. Short and some room outside off, he transfers weight back and picks up a couple
good length on off, he moves across to clip it, but can't go past short midwicket
good length, coming into him, he moves across and tucks it to deep square
good length around off, punched to mid-on
very full on off, driven down the ground but straight to mid-off
tossed up outside off, he comes forward to the pitch of the ball and pushes to cover's left
that's beaten his outside edge. On a length outside off and dipping, not short enough to go back and cut, which he attempted to do, but swished at air
tossed up more, too full and driven past cover
gets the length to cut now, and does so with good timing, picking up a couple with deep cover running to his left to cut it off
pushed towards extra cover to raise a fluent fifty. It's been a fine innings by Balbirnie, he's kept Ireland ticking over
tossed up and he comes forward to drive it past the bowler and to long-on
good length outside off, steered to backward point
full ball on the stumps, driven to mid-on
good length but ends up on the pads while angling in and he's able to tuck it away to deep square pretty easily

good looking shot again by Balbirnie. A touch fuller and he moves across to get into great position and flick it off his pads to deep midwicket. A sprinting chase by the man inside the circle means the ball doesn't have the legs to go to the boundary
good length on the stumps, steered to backward point
too full and angling into the pads again, clipped to mid-on
good length outside off, spinning in, pushed past cover
too full and a full-blooded extra cover drive but can't get past the fielder
fuller on middle, worked to long on with his wrists
good length, turning away and ends up on the pads, clipped to fine leg
that's come out of nowhere. tossed up and dipping on him, he didn't quite get to the pitch of the ball but whipped it with his wrists to go over long-on and it carries all the way

those wrists in play again and Stirling gets his own fifty now. This was bowled wider than the previous one but as full and he makes room to whip it over extra cover, one bounce into the fence. Two brilliantly conceived and executed shots
good length outside off, pushed to deep cover off the back foot
good length angling in and ends on the pads, tucked to fine leg's left
good length on off, he defends back to the bowler off the front foot
strays on the pads again and is clipped away nicely but straight to short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, driven down the ground for a single
nice line again, just on the fourth stump and not enough room to cut. He was giving himself room to do it but doesn't judge the bounce and misses it
fuller, swept to short fine leg
skips down the track and takes it on the half-volley to clip it to long-on
fuller on the stumps, opens the face to drive to the man on the point boundary
a bit too short and spinning into him, ends up on the pads and is clipped to deep midwicket.
fuller, worked with the angle to short midwicket
back of a length outside off he guides it to third man off a horizontal bat, tapping it down
too full and well wide of off, he has a flay at that and sends it over the in field but there is a deep point who fields
too full, on the pads, easy clip to deep midwicket
very full on the stumps, driven crisply to mid-off. Cottrell fumbles and they think about the single but decide against it. Good call because the fielder recovered quickly
back of a length and rising up, he goes back and clips it off his hips but can't get past the in-field
good length on off, punched to mid-on
flatter on a length, reaches out in front of him to sweep it to deep square leg
good length on middle, spinning down leg and helped along with the turn past midwicket
down the track and over the top. Took the attack to the bowler, reached the pitch of the ball and lifted it effortlessly straight back over the bowler
good length on middle and spinning down leg - he really needs to get that line right - and easy pickings, to clip to deep midwicket
better ball, with a better line, just outside off and doesn't spin as much as Stirling though. He was pressing forward, it takes a thick outside edge and runs down to third man

and that's been swept for four. Perhaps not quite full enough to sweep but fine leg is in and Stirling goes for it, gets a bit of a top edge, but enough on it to sail over the inner circle and roll to the boundary
fuller on off, driven to cover
good length outside off, he comes on the front foot and pats it back
good length outside off, he waits for it and steers it to third man
too full and on the pads again, Holder's been straying there. But gets away with it this time as he can't connect with the flick, and it rolls to the keeper off the pad
fuller on off, he presses forward and it takes a thick inside edge to roll towards deep square. They sprint between the wickets to turn one into two
a little short and on the pads, clipped to deep square
and there's the Stirling wrists at work again. Floated up angling across him, he made room by clearing his front leg and whipped this with a horizontal bat over extra cover for another six
fullish but straighter, and he punches to long-on
well placed. Not a great ball, too short, which allows him to go back and punch it, giving him time to place it so that it bisects cover and extra cover. No one on the boundary there so he gets four
defended to the bowler's right
flatter on the stumps and fullish, goes down on one knee to sweep it hard. Deep square leg collects
full ball on the stumps, almost a yorker, he stays on the back foot and strokes it through cover with a horizontal bat
fuller outside off and he goes on one knee to drive this crisply through cover. There is a sweeper back, who collects
lifts this over the in-field but off the toe-end. Slower ball, which is why he was early into the shot. Wanted to send it over extra cover, but it ends up going over cover-point, lands safely
slower ball again, he waits for it and guides it to point
good length, stump to stump, patted towards short cover for a quick single.
picked the slower one this time, and goes over extra cover for a boundary. Too full on middle, he cleared his front leg and lifted this majestically over the top
good length around off, pushed to mid-on
back of a length outside off, he gives himself room and punches this. Times it superbly, and it races across the turf past point where a diving effort can't stop it from going into the boundary

caught at fine leg. Finally the breakthrough via the short ball. This was better than the short balls Stirling has been pulling with impunity, on target and hustled him a bit. Went for the hook again, but only got a top edge. Fine leg is back and holds it in front of his face, looks back to make sure he's not near the rope - he isn't. End of a good innings by Stirling
fuller, angling across him, pushed to mid-off
back of a length angling across, pushed back towards the bowler
strays down leg and is clipped fine, but fine leg is close by and runs around to field
back of a length on off, tried to flick it but it seemed to stop a bit on the pitch and he was too early into the shot. Rolls to short leg off his hip and they decide against a quick single
full outside off, he comes on the front foot to work it away but can't get timing on it, and it rolls into the legside off the toe end
fuller on the stumps, driven down the ground
too full and on the pads, dealt with excellently. Flicked off his pads and to the square leg boundary
round the wicket, angling into him, waits on it and steers it to third man
back of a length outside off, he moves across and pats it down to short fine leg
fuller on the stumps, patted towards short mid-on

got him! Having a slip in there in the 34th over works for West Indies. Good ball on the stumps, and moving across a touch. He's too early into the flick, and the leading edge flies to the widish lone slip.
short of length but down the leg side and called a wide
fuller around off, comes forward to defend but was a bit late. Gets an inside edge on to his pads
short of length and rising towards the batsman who gets on to his toes and dabs it towards square leg
short of length outside off, looks to cut it over backward point but gets beaten
length around off, stays back and cuts it towards point
length around off, O'Brien waits for it before chipping it over mid-off for a boundary
a touch fuller outside off, O'Brien looks to loft it again but ends up slicing over point, comes back for the second
through the covers this time, four more for O'Brien. Length outside off, O'Brien stands tall and punches it uppishly through extra cover
slower length ball outside off, throws his bat at it and gets a single to sweeper cover
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-on for one more
slower one on the stumps, O'Brien was early into the shot and ends up almost chipping it to short midwicket, just short of the fielder
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover
length ball on the stumps, drops it on the off side and scampers through for a single
short of length but around middle and leg, tucked away towards fine leg
short of length around off, Balbirnie bends his back and dabs it towards third man
short of length outside off, punched towards deep backward point for one
length ball angling in towards the batsman who drops it at his feet and sneaks in a single
length ball on the stumps, pushed towards long-on for a single
a touch fuller but down the leg side, Hope uses his pads but can only make a partial stop and concedes a run
short of length on middle and leg, doesn't bounce much but Balbirnie uses the angle and pulls it towards backward square leg boundary
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards extra cover, straight to the fielder
short and wide and Balbirnie cuts it past backward point for a couple, two away from his hundred now
fuller down the leg side, Balbirnie looks to help it on its way but fails to connect
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards deep square leg
fuller and down the leg side, looks like O'Brien got something on it but a tumbling stop by Hope prevents any runs
short of length around off, stands tall and punches it towards cover
length outside off, looks to run it down towards third man but misses
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off
here it is! A brilliant hundred from Balbirnie. Length ball around middle and leg and tucked away towards backward square leg to bring up his fourth ODI ton
short of length on the stumps, punched towards long-on for one
length outside off, slices it over covers, only a single as sweeper cuts it off
fuller around off, driven but straight to mid-off
swiped over midwicket, all the way for a six. Was a length ball around off but Balbirnie knows where the gaps are, clubs it with the angle
length ball around off and middle, backs away and cuts it behind point
length ball on the pads, misses the flick but will get a leg-bye
fuller down the leg side, Balbirnie moves across and looks to paddle it fine, misses. The umpire thinks that wasn't too wide
length ball, angling in to the batsman who stands tall and punches it towards extra cover
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on, a direct hit at the non-striker's end but O'Brien was home
a bouncer, angling towards the batsman. Balbirnie ducks under it
length ball around off and middle, pushes it towards extra cover
short of length outside off, and Balbirnie transfer the weight on the back foot and pulls it over midwicket for four
short of length at the batsman, Balbirnie once again is happy to duck under
short of length around off and middle, comes slower off the wicket, flicked just past the square leg to his right
fuller on the stumps, backs away and chips it just over short midwicket, gets a couple to wide long-on
length outside off, Balbirnie was backing away and cannot reach to the ball in the end
a full toss on the stumps, and Balbirnie just snaps his wrists to send it sailing over deep midwicket
almost in the blockhole this time, Balbirnie digs it out towards wide long-off
a slower length ball outside off, O'Brien gets deceived by the lack of pace, looks to run it towards third man in the end but cannot connect
fuller but down the leg side, called a wide
once again straying down the leg side and wide again
length ball on the pads, flicked towards fine leg for one
fuller on the pads, O'Brien looks to flick but misses
on the pads once again and this time flicked away toward deep square leg
fuller on the stumps, backs away and chips it just over the bowler's head, once again only a single
fuller outside off and lofted over extra cover by O'Brien, a couple of bounces and four
a full toss around off this time but O'Brien fails to take advantage and hits it towards long-off
in the blockhole this time, Balbirnie backs away and steers it towards backward point
slower one but short and wide, Balbirnie cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, looks to go over extra cover but doesn't get the timing right. Was in the air but safe. The long-off fielder runs to his left to make the stop
slower again, length outside off, forehands it towards long-off
fuller on the pads, looks to swipe it away but misses and is rapped on the pads
a slower length ball outside off, Balbirnie backs away and cuts it towards sweeper cover
a full toss on the leg stump and chipped away past short fine leg, the deep-backward square leg comes across to make the stop
a slower one but fuller on the stumps, Balbirnie backs away and lofts it over wide long-on for his fourth six
a low full toss on the pads, helped along but couldn't beat short fine leg
another low full toss, around middle and leg this time, chipped away towards deep midwicket
slower one, fuller outside off, slices it towards deep extra cover, a bit of teamwork there keeps it to two
a low full toss around off, Balbirnie gets his timing wrong this time and ends up hitting it in the air. Holder runs in from long-off and takes it near knee height
fuller on the stumps, almost a yorker, gets an inside edge on to his pads and sprints away for a single
starts with a full toss around off, Adair pushes it back towards the bowler who makes a partial stop
fuller around off, backs away and digs it out towards extra cover
length outside off, chops it towards deep-backward point for a couple
a full toss around middle and leg, backs away and hits it towards deep midwicket
a slower one but full outside off, looks to reach out but cannot put bat on to the ball
fuller, angling on to the pads, Adair misses the flick
a low full toss on the stumps, works it towards deep square leg and comes back for the second
a full toss around middle and leg, hits it to the left of Holder at long-off who looks to stop it with his foot but had to bend in the end
short of length this time, O'Brien backs away and swats it towards long-on
a low full toss on the stumps, digs it out towards long-on and scampers back for the second
another full toss but Adair misses out, mistimes the pull towards deep square leg
fuller outside off, O'Brien fails to get his bat on it but a fumble by Hope behind the stumps allows a bye
in the blockhole, O'Brien backs away digs it out towards long-on
length ball, angling in towards the batsman. Adair looks to swipe away but gets an inside edge on to the pads
length again, Adair gets his connection right this time but only a single to deep midwicket
length around off, O'Brien looks to smash it down the ground but mstiimes it towards fine leg
a full toss around off, O'Brien backs away and hits it towards the left of Roach at mid-off who dives to left but cannot cling on to
length ball, drags it towards long-on for one
fuller on the stumps, backs away and digs it out towards midwicket, comes back for the second
fuller on the leg stump, O'Brien backs away and smashes it over deep midwicket and gets to his half-century with a six
amazing shot! Fuller around off, O'Brien clears his front leg and lofts it over extra cover, and carries all the way for a six
and another one, three in a row. Fuller on the stumps and O'Brien launchers it over the bowler's head for another maximum
bouncer this time, and Holder gets his man. O'Brien cannot control the hook and ends up hitting it towards short fine leg where Cottrell gobbles the ball
that's 300 for Ireland. Short of length outside off and Wilson dabs it towards third man for one
fuller outside off, slaps it towards sweeper cover for one
fuller on the stumps, looks to hit it down the ground but ends up deflecting it on to his pads
fuller around off, gets down and paddles it towards fine leg
fuller around off, backs away and hits it down the ground, the long-on fielder cuts it off
fuller, angling in towards the batsman who clears his front leg and smashes it between long-on and deep midwicket
struck down the ground this time, backs away to a low full toss and lofts it over mid-off to collect another boundary
short of length at the batsman, Wilson looks to pull it away but misses, collects a leg-bye though
fuller outside off, steers it towards cover-point for one
a bouncer this time from Gabriel, Wilson was backing away and looks to pull in the end, misses
a beamer from Gabriel, angling down the leg side, Wilson ducks under it but Hope fails to collect and that's four more for Ireland
length ball angling in, Wilson backs away and takes a wild swing, fails to connect
fuller around off, hits it firmly towards Holder at mid-off
short of length around off and middle, backs away and smashes it over deep midwicket for a six
fuller around off, comes forward and flicks it towards square leg to get off the mark
length ball around off, stays back and pushes it towards covers
good length outside off, patted back to the bowler. Came off the inside half of the bat
fuller but strays on the pads and is flicked away nicely to deep square leg. Fine leg runs to his left to clean up
fuller length on the fourth stump, moves across and flicks it, but straight to midwicket
goes for the yorker, doesn't quite nail it. Picked up off his toes, but once again to the man at short midwicket
starts off with one well down leg and he'll have to re-bowl it
very full outside off, gets it to shape away. Hope stretches into the cover drive, but can't go past the in field
swing gain, but tails down the pads and he's got the timing spot on on the flick, sends it racing to the boundary
good length but on the pads again, tickled to fine leg
better line, gets it on off stump and on a length, but he manages to tuck it to square leg
back of a length outside off, pushed to point

spliced off a thick outside edge over point, not where he was intending to hit it. Lands safely though. Full outside off, he wanted to drive on the up, but the movement meant he ended up getting a thick edge
good length on the stumps, moves across to tuck it to deep square leg
good length outside off, he makes room to cut it past point
up and over. In the slot outside off, too full and he comes forward to loft this over the bowler and into the long-off boundary
good length outside off again, makes room and cuts, but to point
fuller on off, and he comes forward to pat it back to the bowler's right
not getting his line right, on the pads again and Hope is not one to look a gift horse in the mouth. Clips it easily to the deep square leg boundary.
better length now, digs it into the hard length and it moves in a touch, defeats his attempted tuck and rolls into the offside off his thigh pad
short and wide outside off, cuts it powerfully, but straight to point
good length on off, comes forward and nudges this to midwicket
good length outside off, he stands tall in his crease and punches to extra cover
textbook cover drive, but Porterfield tumbles to his left at extra cover to stop the ball. Full outside off and driven very nicely
good length on the stumps, tucked to a square-ish fine leg
stand and deliver. Not the best ball, overpitched on leg stump and he lofts it over mid-on with a full face. Great timing
corrects his length to a less full one and Ambris taps it to midwicket
good length on off stump, he had started to give himself room but ends up bunting it back to the bowler
good length on off, a touch too close to cut, he steers it away from backward point for a single
good length on off, he comes forward and taps it gently into the offside for a quick single
back of a length angling across, he stands tall and punches to cover
back of a length but a bit too straight and he is able to flick it off his pads to deep midwicket by shuffling across
fuller length on the stumps, he was shuffling across and tuns it to square leg
sublime. Back of a length going across him, Hope stands in his crease rises up and drives through the line, threads cover and extra cover for a peachy boundary
that boundary has made him bowl straighter and Hope is now able to shuffle across and clip him to fine leg
back of a length, went to pull but not short enough for that, ends up hitting to mid-on off the bottom half of the bat
stopped on him a bit, might have been the slower one. He was too early into his punch and ends up popping it into the offside. Drops well in front of cover
poor backing up gives them an overthrow. This was a good ball, and he ends up getting a leading edge that drops in front of mid-off, who lets fly a throw. Poor fielding concedes an extra run
strays on the pads that time and Ambris says 'thank you' while flicking it to the fine leg boundary
fuller, wristed to mid-on
fuller on middle, turns it to midwicket
fuller on off, stretches forward to defend
back of a length across him, he stays beside the ball and chops it down to third man
good length on the pads, flicked to fine leg
bouncer, outside off, he sways out of the way and lets it pass through
angled across too far, outside the tram-line and he'll have to re-bowl that
smoked. Too wide across off and he has room to free his arms, opens the face to drive this beautifully past point
almost a carbon copy, but an upgrade. Again room outside off and he stretches out outside off to carve this to the backward point boundary
corrects the line to make it closer to off, Ambris pushes it back to the bowler
fullish around off, plays it to mid-on with a straight bat
that's a lovely looking straight drive, but there is a long-on who runs around to field. Didn't try to hit it too hard, just stroked this from outside off with a straight bat
back of a length outside off, doesn't bounce very high and he punches to mid-off from the bottom half of the bat
good length outside off, steered between cover and point
paddled but there is a short fine leg and luckily the ball is in his direction so he fields it. A little bit to the left or right and that would have been four. Back of a length ball on the leg stump
fuller on middle, comes forward and drives it gently to short mid-on
tapped to long off
too short and too wide outside off. Ambris rocks back and cuts this powerfully through point for a boundary
given some more air outside off and Ambris shows he's not all about the power, executes a delicate late cut, gliding the ball off his bat to third man. Pulled in just inside the boundary
tossed up on a better length and line - on middle and off, he defends off the front foot
smashed. Another free gift, tossed up very invitingly and too full, Hope flays it through cover with a horizontal bat and lots of bottom hand power
goes flatter and on a length, he goes back and defends on off stump
short and wide outside off, slapped powerfully but straight to point
good length on off, took the pace off a bit. He waited for it and nudged it to midwicket from the back foot
fuller outside off, steered to point off the front foot. Wants a quick single, rightly sent back
this is Ireland's bane. Good balls followed by a 'gimme' one. Full and on the pads, straying down leg, easily picked off to the square leg boundary
better ball, dug this in back of a length on the fourth stump, cramped Ambris for room. He jabs it down to third man off his chest
another one on the pads and wristily flicked away, but there is a deep square leg so he cuts off the boundary
on a length on off, spinning away very gently, not much turn. He goes back and whips this to long on
nice loop and dipping on him, a touch full but he comes forward and defends
flatter on the stumps, he makes room and slaps it past the bowler, who dives to his left but can't stop the ball. Fifty for Ambris, he's motored to the landmark
quicker one outside off, he was moving back to cut this but it hurried on to him and he under-edges it back to the bowler
much better over from Dockrell so far. Looped up and drew him forward to defend on middle
ends the over well, perhaps the best of Ireland's innings so far. Flattish around off, jabbed back to the bowler
room outside off and width, slashes it down to third man
short ball and pulled to deep midwicket, where the fielder slides and stops the boundary
caught on the crease that time, length ball that is on off, and he was looking to flick it away off the back foot, comes of slower than he anticipated, and pops up, but well in front of the bowler

brilliant catch by McCollum at point. short and wide outside off, Hope has a slash at it, but it's uppish and to point's right. He dives to his right and holds on with both hands. Ireland have a breather with the opening stand broken.
terrible ball, well down the legside, and it's a wide
angled across him outside off and he's happy to let it go
good length on the pads, tucked to fine leg
good length outside off, and Bravo just pats it away
tossed up on off and turning into him, patted to mid-on
gets room outside off and cuts it away nicely to beat short third man and find the fence. Gave himself room and created the width
the bowler over-corrects but Bravo can't put it away. Looped up on the pads and he flicks it but straight to short fine
tossed up on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
goes back and across to give himself room and cuts it to deep cover
good length outside off and he lets it go
fullish and straight, gets behind it and defends it back to the bowler
back of a length and rising up on middle and leg, he moves inside the line and taps it down to fine leg
strays down the legside again and is turned to deep square leg off his pads
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards mid-off with soft hands and they go through for the quick single. Would have been safe even if the shy at the stumps had hit
back of a length, he goes on the back foot and pulls to deep square leg
tossed up, and he comes down the track to meet it, dips nicely but he gets to the pitch and bunts it to long off
tossed up on off, turning into him, moves behind the ball and hits it back to the bowler
gets behind the line of the ball again on off and this time places it to the bowler's left for a single to long on
beaten. Didn't really turn, around the wicket and outside off, Ambris hangs back to try and steer it away, misses it entirely
patted to long-on
makes room and slaps this slightly back of a length ball outside off to long-off
back of a length, straying on the pads, and is easily tucked to deep square
full, almost yorker length on the fifth stump, driven without timing with a horizontal bat. Ball trickles to short mid-off
back of a length coming into him, he stays in his crease and beside the ball, steers it to third man by opening the bat face
back of a length outside off, he rises on his toes and punches to deep extra cover
back of a length outside off, doesn't bounce much, he chops it past point
poor ball, too full and on the pads, Bravo flicks it away with ease, but the outfield ensures fine leg has time to run around square to field the ball
flat and outside off, a bit on the shorter side, punched to long off
around the wicket, angled into him, given a bit more air. Very full, and driven along the ground to long -off
flat and quick outside off, defended back
flatter again but on the pads, and he wrists it to square leg
angled into him again from around the wicket, given some air but ends up almost a yorker, dug back out to the bowler
Driven back firmly, very full again, but Stirling gets a foot behind it to stop any thoughts of a run
short of length outside off, steered towards deep backward point
short of length down the leg side, pulls it towards fine leg
shot of length once again, drags it towards deep square leg
back-of-the-hand slower one, length around off and Bravo defends it back towards the bowler
another slower one but on the pads this time, flicked towards square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and mistimes the drive towards extra cover

Stirling breaks through. Fuller around off, in the slot for Bravo and he goes for it, looking to clear long-off but doesn't get the power behind it and ends up hitting right down McBrine's throat there
length around off, defends it towards point
length again, a touch straighter this time, punched towards long-on
flatter and fuller around off, defended from the front foot
length ball on middle and leg, turns it towards square leg
length around off, goes back and punches it towards extra cover
in the blockhole at off stump, Chase digs it out towards mid-on
fuller around off, drives it towards deep extra cover, comes back for the second
length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg, Stirling makes a sliding stop
straight over the bowler's head. Fuller around off and Ambris frees his arms, almost carried all the way
short of length around off and Ambris pulls it in front of square, the deep square leg fielder runs to left but cannot cut it off
short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep point
fuller on the stumps, stays back and flicks it behind square
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and pushes it towards mid-on
fuller around middle and off. Defended from the crease
length outside off, looks to play it late past the short third man, doesn't get the timing right
length around off, stays back and punches it past extra cover
length around off, pushed towards the left of the bowler who dives across to make the stop
fuller around off and Ambris lofts it over mid-off, a couple bounces to the long-off boundary
and again. Murtagh  pitched up and Ambris frees his arms, the ball dribbles towards long-off boundary for four more
length ball on the pads, and tucked away behind square for a couple
fuller around off, Ambris drives it back towards the bowler who gets low in his followthrough to make the stop
length ball around off, punched back towards the bowler from the back foot
length outside off, punches it wide of the bowler this time, a single to long-off
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it back towards the bowler
length outside off, stays back and steers it towards short third man
length around off, pushes it towards long-off
length around off, punched off the back foot towards long-off
flatter around off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
dropped short this time and Chase rocks back to pull it towards deep midwicket boundary for four
short of length around off, swivels back to pull it behind square for four
length around off, stays back and tucks it away towards square leg
length ball but down the leg side, Chase goes for the flick but misses. An appeal for caught-behind but not out. Think it just touched the thigh pad
length outside off, dabs it towards third man
length around off, stays back and pushes it back towards the bowler
short of length outside off, chops it away towards backward point
tossed up around middle and leg, driven towards long-off
length around middle and leg, pushed towards the non-striker, the bowler moves across to stop
length again, punched towards short midwicket off the back foot
a touch fuller on the stumps this time, drives it past short midwicket this time
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-off
length around off, comes forward and pushes it towards long-off
length around off and middle, flicked towards short midwicket
short of length down the leg side, goes for the pull but too wide
short of length around off, taps it towards backward point and sets off
short of length around off, punched towards mid-on from the back foot
short outside off and Ambris swivels to pull it in front of square, finds the boundary at deep midwicket
length ball around middle and leg, flicked towards square leg, moves to 98
short of length on the pads, goes for the pull but fails to connect, gets a leg-bye to fine leg
length ball around off, punched off the back foot towards long-on
short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep-backward point, gets to 99
short of length around off, goes back and punches it towards covers
and that's maiden ODI hundred for Sunil Ambris, short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep point and gets to the three-figure mark
tossed up outside off, Chase goes for the cut but misses
length around off, pushed towards deep point from the back foot
length ball down the leg side, goes for the flick and misses
length outside off, goes for the cut, gets an inside edge towards fine leg
length outside off, stays along the line of the ball and steers it towards backward point
a slower one, fuller around off, and Ambris just lofts it over mid-on, without any fuss
another slower one, short of length outside off, pulls it towards deep square leg
short of length outside off, punched towards extra cover, Balbirnie makes a partial stop diving to his left
fuller around off, comes forward and defends it towards mid-off
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
fuller around off, comes down the track and just chips it over extra cover, didn't try to hit it too hard
length ball around middle and leg, goes back and flicks it towards square leg
length ball on the leg stump, looks to force it off the back foot, misses and is rapped on the pads
fuller around off, comes forward and drives it towards covers
short of length outside off, punched off the back foot towards sweeper cover
slower ball goes under his attempted pull. Was targetting cow corner, but doesn't connect
angled into him on a length, steered to third man by opening the bat face
dismissed. Poor ball and gets clobbered. Too short, sat up and gave him all the time in the world. Ambris rocked back and smashed this through midwicket
another poor ball and smashed again. Too short and Ambris swivels to pull this to deep square leg
fuller now outside off, carved to third man
back of a length again, sits up, and he stays in his crease, stands tall and punches past extra cover
good length on the fourth stump, he hangs back and whips it to long-on
fuller on off, driven to long on
good length outside off, stays in his crease and jabs it towards midwicket, where the fielder slides to his left to stop the ball
beaten. On a length, didn't bounce much at all. He wanted to steer it away, but doesn't connect
good length outside off again, change of pace and Ambris unable to time his punch, ends up back with the bowler
paddled fine. Murtagh spoils a good over, but that's the batsman's skill. Good length on of again, he moved across and picked it up from outside off, paddled it very fine
back of a length outside off, he gets up on his toes and stays beside the ball, guiding it to third man
good length and sticking to a tight line on off, he tries to cut it but it rolls off the inside half of the bat
too short and room outside off, stands tall and slaps through cover, but there is protection in the deep
outswinger, ends up just inside the tram line from back of a length, he throws his bat at it and sends it to deep cover
got the placement right. Again room outside off and a bit too short, he goes on the back foot and cuts it powerfully, past a diving backward point, to his left
better length, not short enough to cut, he steers it to short third man
full and straight, goes behind it back and across and on-drives, but short midwicket fields
good length outside off, carved away to deep cover, where a diving stop ensures no boundary
good length on off, whipped to short midwicket, who lets fly a quick throw to the non-striker's end but misses. Ambris might have struggled to make his ground
straight on a length, drives to long on
full, almost yorker length on off, dug back out to the bowler's left, and he moves across to field

length on off, kept low, and Ambris tried to punch it from his crease without moving his feet. Takes the inside edge but goes past the stumps and the keeper, pulled back before it hits the boundary rope
fuller outside off, driven fluently through cover, where Dockrell runs to his right and fires in a flat and fast throw
back of a length outside off, steered fine but Murtagh at short third man dives to his left and stops the ball
loses his line, too far down leg and he'll have to rebowl that
full outside off, mis-times his drive to mid-off
slower ball, but he read it and picked it up well. The length was also too full, and he could flick it off his toes to the midwicket boundary
digs it in short as a retort, and Chase has a go at it, but though he pulls hard, he doesn't time it and jams this into the ground near him
full ball on off, pushed to short mid- on
back of a length on off, bunted to long-on
back of a length on off, flat-batted to long off
outside edge and that's unlucky for the bowler. Bowled it on a fifth stump line, too close to cut. He went for it anyway, and got a thick outside edge. No slip and third man is not fine enough
driven to long on
straight on a length, he shuffles across to whip this fine, but short fine leg dives to his right to stop the ball
fuller again, wanted to flick it away, gets a thick inside edge that goes to deep square
good length outside off, too short to pull, he goes for it anyway, and gets it off the bottom half of the bat to deep square leg
short of length, pulled towards midwicket
takes the pace off and bowls it back of a length on off, and he tries to drive on the up but can't time it well
back of length outside off, cuts it powerfully but cover dives and intercepts
full on the fourth stump, driven unconvincingly to long-off
back of a length and slower ball, he wants to slap it away, ends up under-edging towards point
huge appeal but not given. Length ball, nipping in and though it hit him dead in front, there was an inside edge onto pad. He was trying to swipe across the line
hurries on to him a bit and he bunts it down to long-on
fuller outside off, square driven past point
makes room to cut this from outside off but can't go past short third man
change of pace, length ball outside off, he is a bit early into his punch and toe-ends it back to the bowler
good length outside off, slashed to short third man and they get a single.
short of length outside off, pulls it towards long-off for one
fuller and wide outside off, left alone
bowled'im. Fuller on the stumps. Chase was on the back foot and fails to get his bat on it and the ball sneaks in to hit the leg stump. Kept a little low as well

length ball around off, Carter looks to flick it but ends up playing all around it, gets struck on the knee roll. A huge appeal for lbw, looked close but the umpire thinks otherwise. Was it too high? Maybe as the batsman was well forward
length ball around off, flicks it towards backward square leg for one
short of length outside off, cuts it towards deep point for one
fuller around off and lofted over the bowler's head, crashes into the sightscreen in the most nonchalant manner
short of length around off, dabs it towards backward point and sets off
fuller around off, looks to drive through the off side, gets an inside edge past the stumps
a fumble at mid-off, Porterfield there. Fuller around off and driven firmly, Porterfield dives to his right but fails to make a clean stop
short of length outside off, steers it towards deep-backward point
caught at short third man. Slower length ball outside off, Ambris looks to steer it past the fielder but ends up lobbing it straight to him. Second catch for McBrine
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg
fuller and wider outside off, Holder reaches out for that but cannot connect
short of length angling in towards the batsman, tucked away towards square leg
length outside off, stays back and guides it towards third man
length around off, steered towards third man for one more
fuller around off, smashed down the ground past the bowler to end the over with a four
fuller around off and middle, drives it towards mid-on
pitched up outside off, drives it towards sweeper cover
short of length near the rib cage, fends it towards short midwicket
short of length outside off, gets on the top of the bounce and cuts it towards deep point
fuller on the stumps and Carter lofts it over long-off, presenting the full face of the bat, extending his arms, sheer timing
short of length but down the leg side, needs to be bowled again
a touch fuller on the pads, glanced towards fine leg for one
short of length on middle and leg, flicked towards midwicket
short of length outside off, looks to punch it through covers, gets beaten
length ball around off, flicks it towards short midwicket
fuller on pads, flicked away towards square leg
fuller but way down the leg side
slower one but fuller on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg
in the air but wide of backward point, Holder gets a couple. Was fuller outside and the batsman went for a drive
fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards deep midwicket
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, goes for the reverse sweep but will get only a single to short third man
length ball on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg
fuller on the stumps, backs away and works it towards long-on
fuller on the stumps, squeezes it towards deep extra cover
fuller around off, comes forward and drives, but straight towards mid-off
fuller on the stumps and carted towards deep midwicket, a brilliant effort by Dockrell saves one run for his side
length around off, stands tall and drives it towards mid-off
slower one around off and Holder has launched this over long-off for a huge six
short of length on the stumps, chipped towards long-on but a fumble by McBrine allows the second run
short of length outside off, punched towards deep extra cover for a couple
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep point
fuller outside off, digs it out towards deep extra cover
fuller on the stumps, Carter carts it down the ground but O'Brien dives to his right at long-on and prevents a certain boundary
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
a full toss wide outside off, Carter reaches out and hits it towards extra cover, a misfield there by Porterfield allows the run
full but way outside off, Holder leaves it alone
a high full toss on the stumps, Holder hits it towards long-off
length around off, mistimes it over short midwicket, comes back for the second
fuller outside off, plays towards sweeper cover for one
short of length on the stumps, goes back and pulls it towards deep backward-square leg for four
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
fuller around off, swiped away behind square, Kevin O'Brien puts in the dive, a bit casual though. He gets a hand to it but cannot prevent the boundary
tucked away towards square leg for one
length ball angling across, cuts it late towards third man
one-handed six! Length ball around off and Holder just extends his arms while presenting the full face, over the bowler's head for a six
pulled away ferociously this time, Rankin goes short of length but Holder is waiting on the back foot and pulls it away towards deep square leg
fuller around off, Holder looks to finish it with a six, tries to repeat the shot from earlier in the over but it's a slower one and he can only sky it to Porterfield near mid-off

fuller and angling across, Carter looks to run it down to third man, gets an outside edge that just evades the wicketkeeper, and that's victory for West Indies, their highest successful chase in ODIs. Also, it's only the second time they have chased down a 300-plus total in ODIs
